entry.title: Strong Wind Watch
entry.summary: Northwest winds may approach severe gale in exposed places. Chance of upgrading to a Warning: Moderate.

author.name: Meteorological Service of New Zealand Limited

entry.title: Road Snowfall Warning
entry.summary: Rain may turn to snow for a time early Friday morning. 1 to 3 cm could accumulate about the summit.

author.name: Meteorological Service of New Zealand Limited

entry.title: Road Snowfall Warning
entry.summary: Snow may affect the road overnight Thursday and Friday morning and 2 to 4 cm may accumulate above 800 metres. Further snow showers are possible to 900 metres through Friday afternoon but little if any snow is expected to accumulate on the road. Another period of snow is expected Friday evening.

author.name: Meteorological Service of New Zealand Limited

entry.title: Road Snowfall Warning
entry.summary: Snow lowering to around 600m Friday morning. 3 to 5cm could accumulate above 700 metres with lesser amounts lower down.

author.name: Meteorological Service of New Zealand Limited

entry.title: Road Snowfall Warning
entry.summary: Snow is expected to affect the road Friday morning and 3 to 5 cm of snow may settle near the summit, with lesser amounts down to 800 metres. Snow showers could continue through Friday afternoon but further accumulations are not expected until Friday evening.

author.name: Meteorological Service of New Zealand Limited

entry.title: Road Snowfall Warning
entry.summary: Snow lowering to around 600m Friday morning. 3 to 5cm could accumulate above 700 metres with lesser amounts lower down.

author.name: Meteorological Service of New Zealand Limited

entry.title: Road Snowfall Warning
entry.summary: A period of snow is likely overnight, followed by snow showers through to Friday afternoon. 10 to 20 cm could accumulate about the tunnel, with lesser amounts to 600 metres.

author.name: Meteorological Service of New Zealand Limited
